instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message:
Hi Guys,

i have a Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, with black screen. if i connect the Charger, the fan starts spinning. Does anyone have a idea, how to locate the error.


Thanks a lot!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message:
Start posting some voltages.
Is normal that board starts itself when charger is plugged in.

Do you get all voltages, even VCORE?
Any USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message: Reflow/resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. Touch up joints with leaded solder and reflow it. Very common failure on this model

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message:
I already reballed <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, it's still the same but i found something out. If i press and hold the power button and then connect the charger, it turns on and it works perfectly. i also can restart the machine.

@[B][URL="https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL] I will check later and post the values.[/B]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message: You can’t reball <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> that’s not a thing....in this case, replace <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message:
Do you mean machine starts in SMC bypass?
In such case fan should go to max; thath wouldn't be perfectly working...

<CHIP>U8900</CHIP> is QFN chip; what did you reball???
Let see the result after changing it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message: I just changed <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, but still the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message:
You only told us fan spinning...
Which voltages do you get on that board???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message:
Hi,

as i told you, the machine starts in smc bypass mode. If i connect only charger, without battery, i get the following voltages and if i connect the charger without battery, the fan doesn't spinn:

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G4H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP5V1_CHGR_VDD</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_PWRCTL</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0_GFXIMPVP</SIGNAL>

missing voltages

vcore
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN</SIGNAL>

If i connect an usb mouse, the light of the mouse is blinking.
And the cpu slowly gets hot
Orange light is also present on charger.
And i am using a 60W charger, i hope this is enough.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message:
That board needs 85W charger; be sure to use original one.
If battery has some charge, should also start with 60W charger + battery.
Seems that <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is pulsing; confirmm that.
Check if <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> also pulses...
If yes, check if all voltages (secondary supplies) controlled by these signals pulse too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> 0v

battery is empty 2v

edit: i mesured again, it pulsing but very low voltage 150mv

edit: 2 i mesured now again and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> reaches now 3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Spinning fan
threads.message:
"Check if <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> also pulses...
If yes, check if all voltages (secondary supplies) controlled by these signals pulse too."
An o-scope is able to catch any fast pulse...

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulses?
